{\r\n        require(minter != _minter, \"Same minter\");\r\n        minter = _minter;\r\n        emit SetMinter(_msgSender(), _minter);\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @dev Set new burner role\r\n    /// @param _burner New burner address\r\n    function setBurner(address _burner) external onlyAdmin {\r\n        require(burner != _burner, \"Same burner\");\r\n        burner = _burner;\r\n        emit SetBurner(_msgSender(), _burner);\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    function setDepositor(address _depositor) external onlyAdmin {\r\n        require(depositor != _depositor, \"Same depositor\");\r\n        depositor = _depositor;\r\n        emit SetDepositor(_msgSender(), _depositor);\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @dev Mint new reNFT tokens\r\n    /// @dev Requires Minter role\r\n    /// @param _id Token ID\r\n    /// @param _to Address to transfer minted tokens\r\n    /// @param _amount Amount to mint\r\n    function mint(uint256 _id, address _to, uint256 _amount) external {\r\n        require(_msgSender() == minter, \"!minter\");\r\n        if (totalSupply(_id) == 0) {\r\n            require(_id == 0 || totalSupply(_id - 1) > 0, \"IDs should be sequential\");\r\n            _currentId.increment();\r\n        } else {\r\n            _updateDeposit(_id);\r\n        }\r\n        _mint(_to, _id, _amount, bytes(\"\"));\r\n        emit RealEstateNFTMinted(_id, _msgSender(), _to, _amount);\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @dev Deposit yield to a given token ID\r\n    /// @param _id Token ID\r\n    /// @param _amount Amount to deposit\r\n    /// @param _duration Time to distribute the cumulative yield\r\n    /// @param _startOffset Period of time before yield starts to cumulate\r\n    function deposit(uint256 _id, uint256 _amount, uint128 _duration, uint128 _startOffset) external {\r\n        require(_msgSender() == depositor, \"!depositor\");\r\n        require(_amount > 0, \"!deposit\");\r\n        IERC20Upgradeable(yieldCurrency).safeTransferFrom(_msgSender(), address(this), _amount);\r\n        Deposit memory deposit_ = _deposits[_id];\r\n        uint256 unlockedYield = _unlockableYield(deposit_);\r\n        uint128 unlockStart = now128() + _startOffset;\r\n        _deposits[_id].unlockedAmountPerToken += unlockedYield / totalSupply(_id);\r\n        _deposits[_id].lockedAmount = (deposit_.lockedAmount - unlockedYield) + _amount;\r\n        _deposits[_id].unlockStart = unlockStart;\r\n        _deposits[_id].unlockEnd = unlockStart + _duration;\r\n        emit NewDeposit(_id, _msgSender(), _amount, unlockStart, unlockStart + _duration);\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @notice Claim Yield for a given token ID\r\n    /// @param _id Token ID\r\n    /// @param _to Yield receiver\r\n    function claimYield(uint256 _id, address _to) external {\r\n        _update(_id, _msgSender());\r\n        uint256 userYieldBalance = yieldBalance[_id][_msgSender()];\r\n        yieldBalance[_id][_msgSender()] = 0;\r\n        IERC20Upgradeable(yieldCurrency).safeTransfer(_to, userYieldBalance);\r\n        emit ClaimYield(_id, _msgSender(), _to, userYieldBalance);\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @dev Burns own tokens (will be used for buyouts)\r\n    /// @dev Requires Burner role\r\n    /// @param _id Token ID\r\n    /// @param _originAccount Origin account of the tokens\r\n    /// @param _amount Amount of tokens to burn\r\n    function burn(uint256 _id, address _originAccount, uint256 _amount) external {\r\n        require(_msgSender() == burner, \"!burner\");\r\n        _burnerHelper(_id, _originAccount, _amount);\r\n        _burn(_msgSender(), _id, _amount);\r\n        emit RealEstateNFTBurned(_id, _originAccount, _msgSender(), _amount);\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @notice Get the amount of yield pending for a given token ID and account\r\n    /// @param _id Token ID\r\n    /// @param _account Account to check for pending yield\r\n    function pendingYield(uint256 _id, address _account) external view returns (uint256) {\r\n        uint256 yieldPerToken_ = yieldPerToken(_id);\r\n        return\r\n            yieldBalance[_id][_account] +\r\n            balanceOf(_account, _id) *\r\n            (yieldPerToken_ - yieldPerTokenClaimed[_id][_account]);\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @notice Current time limited to 128 bits\r\n    function now128() public view returns (uint128) {\r\n        return uint128(block.timestamp);\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @notice Get current yield per token\r\n    /// @param _id Token ID\r\n    function yieldPerToken(uint256 _id) public view returns (uint256) {\r\n        Deposit memory deposit_ = _deposits[_id];\r\n        uint256 totalSupply_ = totalSupply(_id);\r\n        if (totalSupply_ == 0) return 0;\r\n        return deposit_.unlockedAmountPerToken + _unlockableYield(deposit_) / totalSupply_;\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @dev Updated yield for an account\r\n    /// @param _id Token ID\r\n    /// @param _account Account to update yield\r\n    function _update(uint256 _id, address _account) internal {\r\n        if (_account == address(0)) return;\r\n        uint256 yieldPerToken_ = yieldPerToken(_id);\r\n        yieldBalance[_id][_account] +=\r\n            balanceOf(_account, _id) *\r\n            (yieldPerToken_ - yieldPerTokenClaimed[_id][_account]);\r\n        yieldPerTokenClaimed[_id][_account] = yieldPerToken_;\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @dev Update deposit information (when totalSupply changes)\r\n    /// @param _id Token ID\r\n    function _updateDeposit(uint256 _id) internal {\r\n        Deposit memory deposit_ = _deposits[_id];\r\n        if (deposit_.lockedAmount == 0 || now128() <= deposit_.unlockStart) return;\r\n        uint256 totalSupply_ = totalSupply(_id);\r\n        if (totalSupply_ == 0) return;\r\n        uint256 unlockedYield = _unlockableYield(deposit_);\r\n        _deposits[_id].lockedAmount -= unlockedYield;\r\n        _deposits[_id].unlockedAmountPerToken += unlockedYield / totalSupply_;\r\n        if (now128() <= deposit_.unlockEnd) _deposits[_id].unlockStart = now128();\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @dev Get the unlockable yield\r\n    /// @param _deposit Deposit object to get the unlockable yield\r\n    function _unlockableYield(Deposit memory _deposit) internal view returns (uint256) {\r\n        if (now128() <= _deposit.unlockStart) return 0;\r\n        if (now128() >= _deposit.unlockEnd) return _deposit.lockedAmount;\r\n        uint128 unlockDuration = _deposit.unlockEnd - _deposit.unlockStart;\r\n        return (_deposit.lockedAmount * (now128() - _deposit.unlockStart)) / unlockDuration;\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @dev Do the necessary operations before burning tokens\r\n    /// @param _id Token ID\r\n    /// @param _originAccount Origin account of the tokens\r\n    /// @param _amount Amount of tokens to burn\r\n    function _burnerHelper(uint256 _id, address _originAccount, uint256 _amount) internal {\r\n        _updateDeposit(_id);\r\n        uint256 yieldPerToken_ = yieldPerToken(_id);\r\n        yieldBalance[_id][_originAccount] +=\r\n            (balanceOf(_originAccount, _id) + _amount) *\r\n            (yieldPerToken_ - yieldPerTokenClaimed[_id][_originAccount]);\r\n        yieldPerTokenClaimed[_id][_originAccount] = yieldPerToken_;\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @dev Extended _beforeTokenTransfer to update accounts' yield balance\r\n    /// @dev See {ERC1155-_beforeTokenTransfer}\r\n    function _beforeTokenTransfer(\r\n        address _operator,\r\n        address _from,\r\n        address _to,\r\n        uint256[] memory _ids,\r\n        uint256[] memory _amounts,\r\n        bytes memory _data\r\n    ) internal virtual override {\r\n        super._beforeTokenTransfer(_operator, _from, _to, _ids, _amounts, _data);\r\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < _ids.length; i++) {\r\n            _update(_ids[i], _from);\r\n            _update(_ids[i], _to);\r\n        }\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /**\r\n     * @dev This empty reserved space is put in place to allow future versions to add new\r\n     * variables without shifting down storage in the inheritance chain.\r\n     * See https://docs.openzeppelin.com/contracts/4.x/upgradeable#storage_gaps\r\n     */\r\n    uint256[42] private __gap;\r\n}\r\n","keccak256":"0x06f9a23cd1fb896ee235f9a2353fc5ce652e1ae0bb8d28d866fcff0bf623b46f","license":"MIT"},"contracts/token/RoyalERC1155Upgradeable.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\r\npragma solidity ^0.8.17;\r\n\r\nimport { ERC2981Upgradeable } from \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/token/common/ERC2981Upgradeable.sol\";\r\nimport { ERC1155Upgradeable } from \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/token/ERC1155/ERC1155Upgradeable.sol\";\r\nimport { IERC2981Upgradeable } from \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/interfaces/IERC2981Upgradeable.sol\";\r\nimport { SingleApprovableERC1155Upgradeable } from \"./SingleApprovableERC1155Upgradeable.sol\";\r\n\r\n/// @title Royal ERC1155\r\n/// @dev Supports EIP-2981 royalties on NFT secondary sales\r\n///      Supports OpenSea contract metadata royalties\r\n///      Introduces fake \"owner\" to support OpenSea collections\r\nabstract contract RoyalERC1155Upgradeable is ERC2981Upgradeable, SingleApprovableERC1155Upgradeable {\r\n    function __RoyalERC1155_init(string memory _uri, address _admin, address _owner) internal onlyInitializing {\r\n        __ERC2981_init();\r\n        __SingleApprovableERC1155_init(_uri, _admin);\r\n        __RoyalERC1155_init_unchained(_owner);\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    function __RoyalERC1155_init_unchained(address _owner) internal onlyInitializing {\r\n        // initialize owner as the \"_owner\", necessary for OpenSea\r\n        _transferOwnership(_owner);\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @dev OpenSea expects NFTs to be \"Ownable\", that is having an \"owner\",\r\n    ///      we introduce a fake \"owner\" here with no authority\r\n    address public owner;\r\n\r\n    /// @notice Contract level metadata to define collection name, description, and royalty fees.\r\n    ///         see https://docs.opensea.io/docs/contract-level-metadata\r\n    /// @dev Should be overwritten by inheriting contracts. By default only includes royalty information\r\n    string public contractURI;\r\n\r\n    /// @dev Fired in setContractURI()\r\n    /// @param _by an address which executed update\r\n    /// @param _value new contractURI value\r\n    event ContractURIUpdated(address indexed _by, string _value);\r\n\r\n    /// @dev Fired in setOwner()\r\n    /// @param _previousOwner previous \"owner\" address\r\n    /// @param _newOwner new \"owner\" address\r\n    event OwnershipTransferred(address indexed _previousOwner, address indexed _newOwner);\r\n\r\n    /// @dev Fired in setDefaultRoyalty()\r\n    /// @param _by Address that called the function\r\n    /// @param _receiver Royalties receiver address\r\n    /// @param _feeNumerator Fee in basis points\r\n    event SetDefaultRoyalties(address indexed _by, address indexed _receiver, uint96 _feeNumerator);\r\n\r\n    /// @dev Fired in setTokenRoyalty()\r\n    /// @param _by Address that called the function\r\n    /// @param _tokenId Token ID which had the royalties set\r\n    /// @param _receiver Royalties receiver address\r\n    /// @param _feeNumerator Fee in basis points\r\n    event SetTokenRoyalty(\r\n        address indexed _by,\r\n        uint256 indexed _tokenId,\r\n        address indexed _receiver,\r\n        uint96 _feeNumerator\r\n    );\r\n\r\n    /// @notice Checks if the address supplied is an \"owner\" of the smart contract\r\n    ///      Note: an \"owner\" doesn't have any authority on the smart contract and is \"nominal\"\r\n    /// @return true if the caller is the current owner.\r\n    function isOwner(address _addr) public view virtual returns (bool) {\r\n        // just evaluate and return the result\r\n        return _addr == owner;\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @dev Set the default royalties info (for all token IDs)\r\n    /// @param _receiver Address of the royalties receiver\r\n    /// @param _feeNumerator Fee in basis points\r\n    function setDefaultRoyalty(address _receiver, uint96 _feeNumerator) external onlyAdmin {\r\n        _setDefaultRoyalty(_receiver, _feeNumerator);\r\n        emit SetDefaultRoyalties(_msgSender(), _receiver, _feeNumerator);\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @dev Set royalties info for a specific token ID\r\n    /// @param _tokenId Token\r\n    /// @param _receiver Address of the royalties receiver\r\n    /// @param _feeNumerator Fee in basis points\r\n    function setTokenRoyalty(uint256 _tokenId, address _receiver, uint96 _feeNumerator) external onlyAdmin {\r\n        _setTokenRoyalty(_tokenId, _receiver, _feeNumerator);\r\n        emit SetTokenRoyalty(_msgSender(), _tokenId, _receiver, _feeNumerator);\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @dev Restricted access function which updates the contract URI\r\n    /// @param _contractURI new contract URI to set\r\n    function setContractURI(string memory _contractURI) external virtual onlyAdmin {\r\n        // update the contract URI\r\n        contractURI = _contractURI;\r\n\r\n        // emit an event first\r\n        emit ContractURIUpdated(msg.sender, _contractURI);\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @dev Restricted access function to set smart contract \"owner\"\r\n    ///      Note: an \"owner\" set doesn't have any authority, and cannot even update \"owner\"\r\n    /// @param _owner new \"owner\" of the smart contract\r\n    function transferOwnership(address _owner) external virtual onlyAdmin {\r\n        _transferOwnership(_owner);\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @notice The denominator of which will be used to calculate the fee (feeNumerator/feeDenominator)\r\n    function feeDenominator() external pure returns (uint256) {\r\n        return _feeDenominator();\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @dev See {IERC165-supportsInterface}.\r\n    function supportsInterface(\r\n        bytes4 interfaceId\r\n    ) public view virtual override(ERC1155Upgradeable, ERC2981Upgradeable) returns (bool) {\r\n        return\r\n            interfaceId == type(IERC2981Upgradeable).interfaceId || ERC1155Upgradeable.supportsInterface(interfaceId);\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @dev Set the smart contract owner\r\n    /// @param _owner new \"owner\" of the smart contract\r\n    function _transferOwnership(address _owner) internal {\r\n        // update \"owner\"\r\n        address oldOwner = owner;\r\n        owner = _owner;\r\n\r\n        // emit an event first - to log both old and new values\r\n        emit OwnershipTransferred(oldOwner, _owner);\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /**\r\n     * @dev This empty reserved space is put in place to allow future versions to add new\r\n     * variables without shifting down storage in the inheritance chain.\r\n     * See https://docs.openzeppelin.com/contracts/4.x/upgradeable#storage_gaps\r\n     */\r\n    uint256[48] private __gap;\r\n}\r\n","keccak256":"0xe9493d5940e824703af091ae0da6b98b40ca0ea824e68a6a5f548e486be4e6b5","license":"MIT"},"contracts/token/SingleApprovableERC1155Upgradeable.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\r\npragma solidity ^0.8.17;\r\n\r\nimport { ERC1155Upgradeable } from \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/token/ERC1155/ERC1155Upgradeable.sol\";\r\nimport { ERC1155SupplyUpgradeable } from \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/token/ERC1155/extensions/ERC1155SupplyUpgradeable.sol\";\r\nimport { ERC1155URIStorageUpgradeable } from \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/token/ERC1155/extensions/ERC1155URIStorageUpgradeable.sol\";\r\nimport { IERC1155Upgradeable } from \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/interfaces/IERC1155Upgradeable.sol\";\r\nimport { UUPSUpgradeable } from \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/proxy/utils/UUPSUpgradeable.sol\";\r\nimport { StringsUpgradeable } from \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/utils/StringsUpgradeable.sol\";\r\n\r\n/// @title Upgradeable Siple Approvable ERC1155\r\n/// @author Yuri Fernandes (HorizonDAO)\r\n/// @dev Allows the approval for a single collection and a certain amount of tokens\r\n///     to be transferred with the allowed party\r\nabstract contract SingleApprovableERC1155Upgradeable is UUPSUpgradeable, ERC1155SupplyUpgradeable {\r\n    using StringsUpgradeable for uint256;\r\n\r\n    function __SingleApprovableERC1155_init(string memory _uri, address _admin) internal onlyInitializing {\r\n        __UUPSUpgradeable_init();\r\n        __ERC1155_init(_uri);\r\n        __ERC1155Supply_init();\r\n        __SingleApprovableERC1155_init_unchained(_admin);\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    function __SingleApprovableERC1155_init_unchained(address _admin) internal onlyInitializing {\r\n        // set contract admin\r\n        admin = _admin;\r\n        emit NewAdmin(_admin);\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    // Optional base URI\r\n    string public baseURI;\r\n\r\n    /// @dev Address of the admin: Can set a new admin among other privileged roles\r\n    address public admin;\r\n\r\n    /// @dev mapping (collectionId => owner => spender => amount)\r\n    mapping(uint256 => mapping(address => mapping(address => uint256))) private _allowances;\r\n\r\n    /// @dev Emitted when allowance is given\r\n    event Approval(uint256 indexed _id, address indexed _owner, address indexed _spender, uint256 _amount);\r\n\r\n    /// @dev Emitted when a new admin is set\r\n    event NewAdmin(address indexed _admin);\r\n\r\n    /// @dev Checks if msg.sender is the admin\r\n    modifier onlyAdmin() {\r\n        require(msg.sender == admin, \"!admin\");\r\n        _;\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @dev Set new admin role\r\n    /// @param _admin New admin address\r\n    function setAdmin(address _admin) external onlyAdmin {\r\n        require(admin != _admin, \"admin == _admin\");\r\n        admin = _admin;\r\n        emit NewAdmin(_admin);\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @dev Sets the {baseURI} for the contract tokens\r\n    /// @param baseURI_ Base URI string ended by SLASH\r\n    function setBaseURI(string memory baseURI_) external virtual onlyAdmin {\r\n        _setBaseURI(baseURI_);\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @dev Sets default URI\r\n    /// @param _tokenURI URI of the token (will be prepended by _baseURI when uri function is called)\r\n    function setURI(string memory _tokenURI) external virtual onlyAdmin {\r\n        _setURI(_tokenURI);\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @notice Get implementation address\r\n    function implementation() external view returns (address) {\r\n        return _getImplementation();\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @notice Approve a spender to transfer tokens\r\n    /// @param _tokenId Collection ID\r\n    /// @param _spender Spender address\r\n    /// @param _amount Amount allowed\r\n    function approve(uint256 _tokenId, address _spender, uint256 _amount) public returns (bool) {\r\n        address owner_ = _msgSender();\r\n        _approve(_tokenId, owner_, _spender, _amount);\r\n        return true;\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @inheritdoc IERC1155Upgradeable\r\n    function safeTransferFrom(\r\n        address _from,\r\n        address _to,\r\n        uint256 _id,\r\n        uint256 _amount,\r\n        bytes memory _data\r\n    ) public override {\r\n        if (_from != _msgSender() && !isApprovedForAll(_from, _msgSender())) {\r\n            require(_allowances[_id][_from][_msgSender()] >= _amount, \"Not authorized\");\r\n            _allowances[_id][_from][_msgSender()] -= _amount;\r\n        }\r\n        _safeTransferFrom(_from, _to, _id, _amount, _data);\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @inheritdoc IERC1155Upgradeable\r\n    function safeBatchTransferFrom(\r\n        address _from,\r\n        address _to,\r\n        uint256[] memory _ids,\r\n        uint256[] memory _amounts,\r\n        bytes memory _data\r\n    ) public virtual override {\r\n        if (_from != _msgSender() && !isApprovedForAll(_from, _msgSender())) {\r\n            for (uint256 i = 0; i < _ids.length; i++) {\r\n                require(_allowances[_ids[i]][_from][_msgSender()] >= _amounts[i], \"Not authorized\");\r\n                _allowances[_ids[i]][_from][_msgSender()] -= _amounts[i];\r\n            }\r\n        }\r\n        _safeBatchTransferFrom(_from, _to, _ids, _amounts, _data);\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @notice Returns the {baseURI} concatenated with {tokenId}\r\n    /// @param _tokenId to get the matadata URI\r\n    function uri(uint256 _tokenId) public view virtual override returns (string memory) {\r\n        return bytes(baseURI).length > 0 ? string(abi.encodePacked(baseURI, _tokenId.toString())) : super.uri(_tokenId);\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @dev See {approve} notice\r\n    /// @param _id Collection ID\r\n    /// @param _spender Spender address\r\n    /// @param _amount Amount allowed\r\n    function _approve(uint256 _id, address _owner, address _spender, uint256 _amount) internal virtual {\r\n        require(_owner != address(0), \"Approve from the zero address\");\r\n        require(_spender != address(0), \"Approve to the zero address\");\r\n\r\n        _allowances[_id][_owner][_spender] = _amount;\r\n        emit Approval(_id, _owner, _spender, _amount);\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @inheritdoc ERC1155SupplyUpgradeable\r\n    function _beforeTokenTransfer(\r\n        address _operator,\r\n        address _from,\r\n        address _to,\r\n        uint256[] memory _ids,\r\n        uint256[] memory _amounts,\r\n        bytes memory _data\r\n    ) internal virtual override {\r\n        ERC1155SupplyUpgradeable._beforeTokenTransfer(_operator, _from, _to, _ids, _amounts, _data);\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @dev Sets `baseURI` as the `_baseURI` for all tokens\r\n    /// @param baseURI_ Base URI string ended by SLASH\r\n    function _setBaseURI(string memory baseURI_) internal virtual {\r\n        baseURI = baseURI_;\r\n    }\r\n\r\n    /// @dev Restrict upgrading to the admin role\r\n    function _authorizeUpgrade(address newImplementation) internal virtual override onlyAdmin {}\r\n\r\n    /**\r\n     * @dev This empty reserved space is put in place to allow future versions to add new\r\n     * variables without shifting down storage in the inheritance chain.\r\n     * See https://docs.openzeppelin.com/contracts/4.x/upgradeable#storage_gaps\r\n     */\r\n    uint256[47] private __gap;\r\n}\r\n","keccak256":"0xae12911a86c2ea0c1ce6f78706e5d616714ddaa722b5a965225c7d4645fc1238","license":"MIT"}},"version":1}

RealEstateNFTMinted(uint256,address,addr.details: Emitted when new reNFTs are minted

SetBurner(address,address).details: Emitted when a new burner is set

SetDepositor(address,address).details: Emitted when a new depositor is set

SetMinter(address,address).details: Emitted when a new minter is set

balanceOf(address,uint256).details: See {IERC1155-balanceOf}. Requirements: - `account` cannot be the zero address.

params._duration: Time to distribute the cumulative yield
params._startOffset: Period of time before yield starts to cumulate

exists(uint256).details: Indicates whether any token exist with a given id, or not.

params._owner: EOA to be used as OpenSea token admin
params._uri: Standard (fallback) URI for the offchain NFT metadata

returns._0: true if the caller is the current owner.

mint(uint256,address,uint256).details: Mint new reNFT tokensRequires Minter role

params._account: Account to check for pending yield

proxiableUUID().details: Implementation of the ERC1822 {proxiableUUID} function. This returns the storage slot used by the implementation. It is used to validate the implementation's compatibility when performing an upgrade. IMPORTANT: A proxy pointing at a proxiable contract should not be considered proxiable itself, because this risks bricking a proxy that upgrades to it, by delegating to itself until out of gas. Thus it is critical that this function revert if invoked through a proxy. This is guaranteed by the `notDelegated` modifier.

royaltyInfo(uint256,uint256).details: Returns how much royalty is owed and to whom, based on a sale price that may be denominated in any unit of exchange. The royalty amount is denominated and should be paid in that same unit of exchange.

safeBatchTransferFrom(address,address,ui.details: xref:ROOT:erc1155.adoc#batch-operations[Batched] version of {safeTransferFrom}. Emits a {TransferBatch} event. Requirements: - `ids` and `amounts` must have the same length. - If `to` refers to a smart contract, it must implement {IERC1155Receiver-onERC1155BatchReceived} and return the acceptance magic value.

safeTransferFrom(address,address,uint256.details: Transfers `amount` tokens of token type `id` from `from` to `to`. Emits a {TransferSingle} event. Requirements: - `to` cannot be the zero address. - If the caller is not `from`, it must have been approved to spend ``from``'s tokens via {setApprovalForAll}. - `from` must have a balance of tokens of type `id` of at least `amount`. - If `to` refers to a smart contract, it must implement {IERC1155Receiver-onERC1155Received} and return the acceptance magic value.
